results.title: Sign Up for the Science Times Newsletter
results.abstract: Every week, we’ll bring you stories that capture the wonders of the human body, nature and the cosmos.

results.title: The Tick That Causes a Meat Allergy Is on the Move
results.abstract: The lone star tick can trigger an allergic reaction to red meat in those bitten. Now this arachnid’s territory is expanding.

multimedia.caption: A female lone star tick, or Amblyomma americanum, that was collected in Maryland.
multimedia.copyright: NIAID/Universal Images Group, via Getty Images

results.title: Did Warming Play a Role in Deadly South African Floods? Yes, a Study Says.
results.abstract: Climate change sharply increased the chances of catastrophic rains in the country’s east, a team of researchers has found.

multimedia.caption: Residents of Inanda, a township north of Durban, searched rubble and debris from floods in April.
Residents of Inanda, a township north of Durban, searched rubble and debris from floods in April.
Residents of Inanda, a township north of Durban, searched rubble and debris from floods in April.

results.title: South Korea Turns to Surveillance as ‘Ghost Surgeries’ Shake Faith in Hospitals
results.abstract: After scandals in which doctors let unsupervised assistants operate on patients, the country is becoming one of the first to require cameras in operating rooms.

multimedia.caption: Kookmin Hospital, near Seoul, voluntarily put cameras in its operating rooms in 2020. A new law will make them mandatory nationwide.
multimedia.copyright: Chang W. Lee/The New York Times

multimedia.caption: Kookmin Hospital, near Seoul, voluntarily put cameras in its operating rooms in 2020. A new law will make them mandatory nationwide.
multimedia.copyright: Chang W. Lee/The New York Times

results.title: Dinosaur Skeleton Sells for $12.4 Million at Christie’s
results.abstract: The remains of a Deinonychus antirrhopus, the beast that inspired the velociraptor in “Jurassic Park,” are believed to be the first of their kind sold at a public auction.

multimedia.caption: The Deinonychus antirrhopus specimen, nicknamed Hector, was discovered in Montana.
The Deinonychus antirrhopus specimen, nicknamed Hector, was discovered in Montana.
The Deinonychus antirrhopus specimen, nicknamed Hector, was discovered in Montana.

results.title: Biden Administration Cancels Drilling Sales in Alaska and Gulf of Mexico
results.abstract: Republicans link the move to rising gas prices while the administration said it was a result of conflicting legal opinions and a lack of interest among bidders.

multimedia.caption: An oil and gas platform in the Cook Inlet of Alaska in 2013.
An oil and gas platform in the Cook Inlet of Alaska in 2013.
An oil and gas platform in the Cook Inlet of Alaska in 2013.

results.title: F.D.A. Authorizes Underwear to Protect Against S.T.I.s During Oral Sex
results.abstract: It’s the first time underwear has been authorized for this purpose, and it provides a new choice for protection where the few options have been unpopular.

multimedia.copyright: Jovelle Tamayo for The New York Times
Jovelle Tamayo for The New York Times
Jovelle Tamayo for The New York Times

results.title: The Man Who Controls Computers With His Mind
results.abstract: 16 years ago, Dennis DeGray was paralyzed in an accident. Now, implants in his brain allow him some semblance of control.

results.title: Moderna Vaccine Provokes Strong Immune Response in Children 6 to 11
results.abstract: Antibody levels rose in the children who received it, suggesting the vaccine protects against infection. But the data were gathered before the arrival of Omicron.

multimedia.caption: A vaccine site offered its services to people over age 5 in Los Angeles in March.
multimedia.copyright: Alisha Jucevic for The New York Times

results.title: Air Pollution Can Mean More, or Fewer, Hurricanes. It Depends Where You Live.
results.abstract: Smog from factories and cars has led to more storms in the Atlantic Ocean, but fewer in the Pacific. A new study explains why.

multimedia.caption: Four storms off the east coast of North America in September 2020.
Four storms off the east coast of North America in September 2020.
Four storms off the east coast of North America in September 2020.

results.title: Russia Was Behind Cyberattack in Run-Up to Ukraine War, Investigation Finds
results.abstract: The February attack rattled Pentagon officials and private industry because it revealed new vulnerabilities in global communications systems.
results.byline: By David E. Sanger and Kate Conger

multimedia.caption: Investigators said the Russian military intelligence agency took satellite communications in Ukraine offline. The attack came before the Feb. 24 invasion launched by President Vladimir V. Putin.
Investigators said the Russian military intelligence agency took satellite communications in Ukraine offline. The attack came before the Feb. 24 invasion launched by President Vladimir V. Putin.
Investigators said the Russian military intelligence agency took satellite communications in Ukraine offline. The attack came before the Feb. 24 invasion launched by President Vladimir V. Putin.

results.title: How big is the Great Pacific Garbage Patch?
results.abstract: Some 1.8 trillion pieces of plastic are estimated to be floating in an accumulation zone in the middle of the Pacific Ocean.
results.kicker: Test Your Knowledge of the Universe

multimedia.caption: A prototype from the Ocean Cleanup company captured plastic debris from the Great Pacific Garbage Patch in the Pacific Ocean in 2019.
A prototype from the Ocean Cleanup company captured plastic debris from the Great Pacific Garbage Patch in the Pacific Ocean in 2019.
A prototype from the Ocean Cleanup company captured plastic debris from the Great Pacific Garbage Patch in the Pacific Ocean in 2019.

results.title: Teens in Distress Are Swamping Pediatricians
results.abstract: Around the country, the setting for adolescent mental health care looks ever more like this doctor’s office in Kentucky, the next patient arriving every 15 minutes.
results.byline: By Matt Richtel and Annie Flanagan

multimedia.caption: Dr. Melissa Dennison, a pediatrician in Glasgow, Ky. “If I’ve got this child and they’re cutting and saying they’re going to kill themselves, I’ll say, ‘Well, I’ll see them today,’” she said. “If I call a child psychiatrist, they say, ‘I’ll see them in a month.’”

Dr. Melissa Dennison, a pediatrician in Glasgow, Ky. “If I’ve got this child and they’re cutting and saying they’re going to kill themselves, I’ll say, ‘Well, I’ll see them today,’” she said. “If I call a child psychiatrist, they say, ‘I’ll see them in a month.’”

results.title: House Panel to Hold Public Hearing on Unexplained Aerial Sightings
results.abstract: A subcommittee of the House Intelligence Committee will hear testimony next week from two Pentagon officials.
results.byline: By Leslie Kean and Ralph Blumenthal
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

multimedia.caption: Videos show an encounter between a Navy Super Hornet and an unknown object.
Videos show an encounter between a Navy Super Hornet and an unknown object.
Videos show an encounter between a Navy Super Hornet and an unknown object.

results.title: Oil Giants Sell Dirty Wells to Buyers With Looser Climate Goals, Study Finds
results.abstract: The transactions can help major oil and gas companies clean up their own production by transferring polluting assets to a different firm, the analysis said.

multimedia.caption: Flares burning in the Niger Delta region of Nigeria in 2021.
Flares burning in the Niger Delta region of Nigeria in 2021.
Flares burning in the Niger Delta region of Nigeria in 2021.

results.title: Sizing Up the Decisions of Older Adults
results.abstract: A new training tool helps to assess whether some seniors can make informed choices about their own care and well-being.

multimedia.caption: The Interview for Decisional Abilities, or IDA, was developed by two geriatricians to help train Adult Protective Services workers in how to gather information about a client’s decision-making ability.

The Interview for Decisional Abilities, or IDA, was developed by two geriatricians to help train Adult Protective Services workers in how to gather information about a client’s decision-making ability.

The Interview for Decisional Abilities, or IDA, was developed by two geriatricians to help train Adult Protective Services workers in how to gather information about a client’s decision-making ability.

results.title: Hundreds of Suicidal Teens Sleep in Emergency Rooms. Every Night.
results.abstract: With inpatient psychiatric services in short supply, adolescents are spending days, even weeks, in hospital emergency departments awaiting the help they desperately need.
results.byline: By Matt Richtel and Annie Flanagan

results.title: Quotation of the Day: Trump Ally in Nebraska Opens Feuds in G.O.P.
results.abstract: Quotation of the Day for Sunday, May 8, 2022.

results.title: Dr. Morton Mower, Inventor of Lifesaving Heart Device, Dies at 89
results.abstract: With a colleague, he created a miniaturized defibrillator that could be implanted inside patients suffering from potentially fatal arrhythmia.

multimedia.caption: Dr. Morton Mower in an undated photo. A device he helped invent saved many lives by returning potentially fatal irregular heart rhythms to normal with an electrical jolt.
multimedia.copyright: Jewish National Fund-USA, via Associated Press

results.title: In Alabama’s ‘19th Unnamed Cave,’ a Trove of Ancient Dark-Zone Art
results.abstract: Researchers using 3-D technology brought to light an array of art in an Alabama cave, including a serpent, flying creatures and humanoid figures in regalia.

multimedia.caption: Stephen Alvarez worked on the photogrammetry project inside the main art gallery of the 19th Unnamed Cave in Alabama.
Stephen Alvarez worked on the photogrammetry project inside the main art gallery of the 19th Unnamed Cave in Alabama.
Stephen Alvarez worked on the photogrammetry project inside the main art gallery of the 19th Unnamed Cave in Alabama.

results.title: C.D.C. Is Investigating 109 Cases of Hepatitis in Children, Including 5 Deaths
results.abstract: The agency stressed that the disease was still very rare in children and that a cause had not been determined.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

multimedia.caption: The C.D.C.’s case reports date from October and span 25 states and territories.
The C.D.C.’s case reports date from October and span 25 states and territories.

results.title: A Return Trip to Timothy Leary’s Psychedelic, Day-Glo Mexico
results.abstract: Most travelers descending on Zihuatanejo are unaware of the resort city’s storied past with the apostle of psychedelic drugs, and his experiments in consciousness expansion.

multimedia.caption: A view of Zihuatanejo, Mexico, from the sunset bar at the Hotel Catalina Beach Resort. The hotel was the setting of an ecstatic 1960s retreat organized by Timothy Leary, an apostle of psychedelic drugs.
multimedia.copyright: Adrian Wilson for The New York Times

results.title: Can Covid Lead to Impotence?
results.abstract: Some studies find higher rates of erectile dysfunction among men recovering from the illness. But other factors related to the pandemic, like heightened anxiety, may also be to blame.

multimedia.caption: A patient with long Covid is examined in a hospital in Israel. Some research indicates that the coronavirus may linger in cells in the male genital tract.
A patient with long Covid is examined in a hospital in Israel. Some research indicates that the coronavirus may linger in cells in the male genital tract.

results.title: For a Shy Porpoise, Rare Good News
results.abstract: New research suggests that vaquitas are not doomed to extinction by inbreeding.

results.title: Museum of Natural History’s Renewed Hall Holds Treasures and Pain
results.abstract: Its oldest gallery, Northwest Coast Hall, reopens May 13 with rare cultural objects and a fresh emphasis on the lives of Indigenous people who made them.

multimedia.caption: The Northwest Coast Hall will reopen at the American Museum of Natural History after a five-year renovation on May 13, with new discoveries and exhibits developed with Indigenous communities from the Pacific Northwest Coast.

The Northwest Coast Hall will reopen at the American Museum of Natural History after a five-year renovation on May 13, with new discoveries and exhibits developed with Indigenous communities from the Pacific Northwest Coast.

The Northwest Coast Hall will reopen at the American Museum of Natural History after a five-year renovation on May 13, with new discoveries and exhibits developed with Indigenous communities from the Pacific Northwest Coast.

results.title: Signs of an Animal Virus Discovered in Man Who Received a Pig’s Heart
results.abstract: The patient showed no sign of rejecting the genetically modified organ, but suffered numerous complications before dying.

multimedia.caption: A heart from a genetically modified pig transplanted into a human patient, David Bennett Sr. He carried DNA from an animal virus, his surgeon disclosed.
multimedia.copyright: University of Maryland School of Medicine, via Reuters
